content:
• Monday, September 10, 2012
  • AIG

    The Treasury prices its 553.8M share offering of AIG at $32.50/share, raising $18B. As expected,...

    The Treasury prices its 553.8M share offering of AIG at $32.50/share, raising $18B. As expected, AIG purchases about $5B of the offering. Giving itself a pat on the back, Treasury says it's recovered all and more of the $182B 2008 bailout of AIG, and still owns a 21.5% stake in the company. AIG -1.3% AH to $32.87. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:20 PM | 3 Comments
  • FIVE

    More on Five Below (NASDAQ:FIVE): shares slip in after hours trading despite its debut F2Q...

    More on Five Below (NASDAQ:FIVE): shares slip in after hours trading despite its debut F2Q earnings report beating across the board on a 40% Y/Y jump in sales. Net profit fell 44% however, as the teen discount retailer logged heavy debt-related expenses. The stock has been a charger since its IPO in July, have already doubled it's $17 offering price. Shares -5.9% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:51 PM
  • PANW

    Palo Alto Networks (NYSE:PANW) guides on its FQ4 call for FQ1 revenue of $80M-$84M and EPS of...

    Palo Alto Networks (NYSE:PANW) guides on its FQ4 call for FQ1 revenue of $80M-$84M and EPS of $0.03; the former is mostly above an $80.1M consensus, but the latter is only in-line, as the next-gen firewall vendor continues to price aggressively and invest heavily in sales. Palo Alto also claimed it added over 1K customers for the third consecutive quarter, increasing the size of its base to above 9,000. Shares -10.8% AH - a strong post-IPO run-up had led them to be priced for perfection.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:16 PM
  • CASY

    More on Casey's General Stores (NASDAQ:CASY): FQ1 comes in flat on the revenue side, but beats...

    More on Casey's General Stores (NASDAQ:CASY): FQ1 comes in flat on the revenue side, but beats on its bottom line number as major remodels and a conversion to 24-hour operations helped offset higher commodity costs, competitive cigarette pricing and higher gas prices. Same-store sales ex-gas rose 2.6% while the segment's margin widened to 33.4% from 32.5%. Same store gasoline sales slid 0.2% with an average margin of $0.149 per gallon. Shares +8.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:11 PM
  • SON

    Sonoco Products (NYSE:SON) -3.3% AH after lowering Q3 EPS guidance, primarily due to operating...

    Sonoco Products (NYSE:SON) -3.3% AH after lowering Q3 EPS guidance, primarily due to operating problems at some North American uncoated recycled paperboard mills which have led to unscheduled downtime and related excess costs. SON also withdraws full-year guidance, citing lower than expected volumes in many of its consumer and industrial packaging businesses.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:05 PM | 1 Comment
  • SHFL

    More on Shuffle Master (NASDAQ:SHFL): FQ3 misses across the board despite a 9% increase in total...

    More on Shuffle Master (NASDAQ:SHFL): FQ3 misses across the board despite a 9% increase in total Y/Y revenue. Net profit rose on strong demand for its electronic gambling machines, but it wasn't enough to match lofty Street expectations. The stock is up 32% so far this year due to a sustained upswing in revenue and earnings. This, on the surface, appears to have prompted analysts to overreach for the quarter. Shares -7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:55 PM
  • AMRN

    Amarin (NASDAQ:AMRN) says the FDA has not yet made a determination with respect to the...

    Amarin (NASDAQ:AMRN) says the FDA has not yet made a determination with respect to the regulatory exclusivity of Vascepa, and has not included it in its mid-August update to its Orange Book, which is due on or about September 14, 2012. Shares -2.6% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:31 PM | 6 Comments
  • NAVB

    Navidea Biopharmaceuticals (NYSEMKT:NAVB) is getting hammered after hours as the FDA rejects the...

    Navidea Biopharmaceuticals (NYSEMKT:NAVB) is getting hammered after hours as the FDA rejects the New Drug Application for its Lymphoseek injection. In the rejection letter, the FDA noted the decision was focused on issues with third-party Lymphoseek contract manufacturing, and was not related to any efficacy or safety data filed within the drug's application. Shares -37% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:20 PM | 2 Comments
  • OCSL

    Fifth Street Finance (FSC) commences a secondary offering of 7.5M shares with the underwriters...

    Fifth Street Finance (FSC) commences a secondary offering of 7.5M shares with the underwriters receiving an option for an additional 1.125M. The immediate use of proceeds will be to pay down its credit lines, though the firm expects to soon draw on them to make additional investments. Shares -2% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:59 PM
  • PTE

    Majesco Entertainment (COOL): FQ3 EPS of -$0.09 misses by $0.05. Revenue of $9.1M (-53.3% Y/Y)...

    Majesco Entertainment (COOL): FQ3 EPS of -$0.09 misses by $0.05. Revenue of $9.1M (-53.3% Y/Y) misses by $4M. Shares -13.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM | 1 Comment
  • FIVE

    Five Below (NASDAQ:FIVE): Q2 EPS of $0.04 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $86.8M (+40% Y/Y) beats by...

    Five Below (NASDAQ:FIVE): Q2 EPS of $0.04 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $86.8M (+40% Y/Y) beats by $4M. Shares -9.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM
  • PANW

    Palo Alto Networks (NYSE:PANW): FQ4 EPS of $0.03 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $75.6M (+88% Y/Y)...

    Palo Alto Networks (NYSE:PANW): FQ4 EPS of $0.03 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $75.6M (+88% Y/Y) beats by $10M. Shares -5.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM
  • KOP

    Shares of carbon compounds and treated wood products producer Koppers Holdings (KOP +4%) are...

    Shares of carbon compounds and treated wood products producer Koppers Holdings (KOP +4%) are raised to Buy from Hold at Keybanc, which says that while low aluminum prices are creating some further risk of additional production curtailment, it suspects this is reflected in the current valuation. Plus, recent capacity reduction could lead to firming of aluminum prices.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM
  • AONEQ

    Shares of A123 Systems (AONE +15%) resume trading following a trigger-induced halt, reversing...

    Shares of A123 Systems (AONE +15%) resume trading following a trigger-induced halt, reversing course in a squeeze on no significant news. The stock triggered short-sale restrictions throughout most of last week, in continuation of a move to the downside started in late August after GM announced it was temporarily halting Volt production.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:40 PM
  • TSLA

    Shares of Tesla Motors (TSLA -6.6%) trade lower with headlines over the cost of Chevrolet Volts...

    Shares of Tesla Motors (TSLA -6.6%) trade lower with headlines over the cost of Chevrolet Volts raining on the EV parade a bit. After a dismissed probe over Chevy Volt fires was overly hyped by Tesla critics as systemic of the entire industry, the development costs for electric car models is a much more relevant issue for investors.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:39 PM | 5 Comments
  • RIG

    Analysts like Transocean’s (RIG -3.1%) decision to sell 38 older shallow-water rigs, but...

    Analysts like Transocean’s (RIG -3.1%) decision to sell 38 older shallow-water rigs, but they’re not thrilled with the $1.05B price. Wells Fargo says the deal boils down to RIG netting ~$700M for rigs it values at $2.2B, and predicts RIG will end up realizing an $800M-$900M accounting loss on the sale. Hercules Offshore (HERO -1.3%), owner of the world’s largest shallow-water drilling fleet, also slides.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:28 PM | 3 Comments
  • NBL

    Noble Energy (NBL +2.6%) is reiterated as a Top Pick by FBR Capital, which expects NBL's...

    Noble Energy (NBL +2.6%) is reiterated as a Top Pick by FBR Capital, which expects NBL's analyst day in December will see growth rate guidance average 20%-plus in the 2012-16 window from 15% current guidance and 8% this year. The firm thinks investors will be surprised that the growth will be "oilier, more domestic oriented, and from more diverse sources than ever before."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:12 PM
  • MTRX

    Matrix Service (MTRX +4.9%) is upgraded to Overweight by First Analysis, which says many of the...

    Matrix Service (MTRX +4.9%) is upgraded to Overweight by First Analysis, which says many of the factors that hurt FQ4 results are temporary. The firm says MTRX, which supplies above-ground storage tanks and aftermarket tank products, is positioned to capture energy and chemical infrastructure construction growth, gain share through geographic expansion, and improve profitability.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM
  • MLM

    Martin Marietta Materials (MLM +4%) is upgraded to Overweight with a raised price target of $97...

    Martin Marietta Materials (MLM +4%) is upgraded to Overweight with a raised price target of $97 from $85 at Stephens, which thinks 2013 could shake out to be a fine year: "It sounds like demand continues to move in the right direction within most of MLM's end markets, though modestly at this point, with the exception of housing which is obviously hanging in better than expected."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:42 PM
  • ANTM

    Wellpoint (WLP -1.6%) slides on comments made today at Morgan Stanley’s healthcare...

    Wellpoint (WLP -1.6%) slides on comments made today at Morgan Stanley’s healthcare conference, where CFO Wayne DeVeydt said the insurer isn't ready to provide guidance for its 2013 results. Mr. DeVeydt cites difficulties with its commercial business and changes associated with the Affordable Care act. He also added that the company hadn't yet set a timeline for finding a permanent replacement for former CEO Angela Braly, who resigned on August 28. (Webcast)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:41 PM | 1 Comment
  • GTATQ

    Positive comments from Piper Jaffray are helping GT Advanced Technologies (GTAT +8.5%) shoot...

    Positive comments from Piper Jaffray are helping GT Advanced Technologies (GTAT +8.5%) shoot higher today. Piper thinks sapphire panels manufactured using GT's equipment could carry a price premium relative to Corning's (NYSE:GLW) Gorilla Glass in mobile device applications. GT has been struggling to cope with weak demand from its core LED and solar equipment markets.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:38 PM | 4 Comments
  • RIG

    Transocean (RIG -2.2%) discloses in an 8-K filed this morning it had discussions with the...

    Transocean (RIG -2.2%) discloses in an 8-K filed this morning it had discussions with the Justice Department seeking to resolve $1.5B in claims related to the Gulf oil spill, but the parties have been unable to agree on a settlement. FBR Capital sees the figure in line with its expectation and RIG's $2B reserve, and such a specific focus is a "positive sign of potential settlement."
     
     
     
     
    | 2:32 PM
  • PXP

    Plains Exploration's (PXP -10%) debt-fueled $5.5B purchase of BP assets isn't seen as cheap by...

    Plains Exploration's (PXP -10%) debt-fueled $5.5B purchase of BP assets isn't seen as cheap by analysts, but PXP likely will pursue development options with the fields that could justify "a value above what the fields would be worth if left in BP's hands," Tudor Pickering says. CEO James Flores sees the chance to pick up assets BP didn't want to redevelop as a "once-in-a-cycle opportunity."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:18 PM
  • CELG

    Celgene (CELG -2.5%) slides on a UBS downgrade to Neutral on valuation this morning. The firm...

    Celgene (CELG -2.5%) slides on a UBS downgrade to Neutral on valuation this morning. The firm cites a lack of significant upside to its anemia drug Revlimid, saying the story has already "played itself out" since approval for the drug was shot down in the European Union.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:10 PM | 2 Comments

  • Hedgeye thinks McDonald's (MCD +0.4%) needs to simplify its menu instead of broadly expanding...

    Hedgeye thinks McDonald's (MCD +0.4%) needs to simplify its menu instead of broadly expanding it. Though global marco issues are certainly in play, the company also faces domestic competition from hamburger upstarts such as Five Guys and Shake Shack that it needs to watch.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:09 PM | 1 Comment
  • YELP

    Heavily-shorted Yelp (YELP +2.5%) once more adds to the giant gains it has seen since its lockup...

    Heavily-shorted Yelp (YELP +2.5%) once more adds to the giant gains it has seen since its lockup expiration ended without top execs or VC investors unloading shares. Lord Abbett has been aggressively buying Yelp, which has benefited from hopes a bigger Web or mobile player will make a bid. The money manager now owns 1.4M shares of the reviews site.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:57 PM
  • P

    Pandora (P -5%) is adding to the giant losses it saw on Friday on a report Apple is working on a...

    Pandora (P -5%) is adding to the giant losses it saw on Friday on a report Apple is working on a rival service (I, II). The decline comes even though Pandora released decent August audience metrics this morning. U.S. radio listening share was 6.30%, up from 6.13% in July and 3.67% in August '11. Active listeners +2.4% M/M and +48% Y/Y to 56.2M. Listener hours +3.6% M/M and +70% Y/Y to 1.16B - those numbers suggest hours/user are growing. (July metrics)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:30 PM

  • Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR +10.0%) cruise past $30 with momentum now firmly at its...

    Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR +10.0%) cruise past $30 with momentum now firmly at its back. SA author Qineqt prefers to focus on fundamental factors such as lingering questions on inventory and the effect of increasing competition on profit margins, as the group strikes a cautious tone.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:28 PM
  • VRA

    Shares of Vera Bradley (VRA +6.7%) rally after SAC Capital discloses that it holds a 5.8% stake...

    Shares of Vera Bradley (VRA +6.7%) rally after SAC Capital discloses that it holds a 5.8% stake in the company. Another positive sign for the company is that social network tracking indicates Vera Bradley backpacks are popular this year with the teenage back-to-school crowd and on college campuses.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:57 PM | 1 Comment
  • FNV

    Despite raising forecasts for gold and silver as talk of another possible round of QE escalates,...

    Despite raising forecasts for gold and silver as talk of another possible round of QE escalates, UBS cuts its rating on several precious metals miners citing a significant run-up in equity prices over recent weeks. The firm lowers Franco-Nevada (FNV -4.3%), Royal Gold (RGLD -1.8%) and Hecla Mining (HL -1.2%) to Neutral from Buy: I, II, III.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:48 PM

  • Apollo Group (APOL -5.1%) slumps as chatter builds up that David Einhorn has a short position in...

    Apollo Group (APOL -5.1%) slumps as chatter builds up that David Einhorn has a short position in the for-profit education company. It could be nothing more than a rehashing of an old rumor, but with the embattled company facing a myriad of issues it's been more than enough to fire up some selling.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM
  • NDZ

    Shares of Nordion (NDZ -35%) melt down after the company announced plans to suspend its...

    Shares of Nordion (NDZ -35%) melt down after the company announced plans to suspend its quarterly dividend in response to an arbitration loss relating to claims against Atomic Energy of Canada for the cancelled construction of its MAPLE facilities. The facilities were the nuclear reactors and processing facility that were being constructed by AECL to serve as the source of NDZs long-term medical isotope supply.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:44 PM
  • JAGGF

    Investors cheer hoped-for stability at Jaguar Mining (JAG +16.6%), which names David Petroff as...

    Investors cheer hoped-for stability at Jaguar Mining (JAG +16.6%), which names David Petroff as its new president and CEO to replace interim head John Andrews. In June, JAG said it would dissolve its three-person office of the chairman committee and named Andrews as its interim CEO succeeding Daniel Titcomb, who abruptly departed in December.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:15 PM | 1 Comment
  • EXC

    Exelon (EXC -1.5%) is downgraded to Sell from Neutral with a $31 price target at Citigroup,...

    Exelon (EXC -1.5%) is downgraded to Sell from Neutral with a $31 price target at Citigroup, driven by its Street-low forecasted EPS outlook of $2.25 in 2014. The firm believes CENG O&M costs are not fully reflected in Street estimates. The downgrade is valuation driven; the firm says it has not changed its fundamental view of the company.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM | 4 Comments
  • CDMO

    Peregrine Pharmaceuticals (PPHM +9.1%) moves up after its FQ1 beat estimates across the board on...

    Peregrine Pharmaceuticals (PPHM +9.1%) moves up after its FQ1 beat estimates across the board on fewer than anticipated losses, despite a double digit Y/Y decline in total revenue. The stock soared on Friday, after the company said a recent Phase IIb trial of its lung cancer treatment bavituximab produced interim data showing statistically significant improvement in overall survival.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:49 AM
  • RIC

    Richmont Mines (RIC +2.4%) reports new deep drill results reaffirm promising potential at depth...

    Richmont Mines (RIC +2.4%) reports new deep drill results reaffirm promising potential at depth at its Island Gold Mine in Ontario. Drill results suggest the C Zone is the most continuous of the four zones in the deep drilling program, which appears to be a continuation at depth of the zone currently being mined at Island Gold.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:44 AM
  • INTC

    While AMD benefits from a Goldman upgrade, Intel (INTC -2.7%) is heading south as more negative...

    While AMD benefits from a Goldman upgrade, Intel (INTC -2.7%) is heading south as more negative Street commentary arrives in response to Friday's warning. CLSA and Miller Tabak see little reason to go long while PC demand remains depressed, and Nomura predicts weak notebook sales will result in 2013 EPS of $2, well below a consensus of $2.33. Also, JPMorgan is now predicting 2012 PC sales will fall 2.3% Y/Y.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:43 AM | 4 Comments
  • MLNX

    Mellanox (MLNX -10.5%) announces CFO Michael Gray is retiring effective Nov. 5. Gray, who has...

    Mellanox (MLNX -10.5%) announces CFO Michael Gray is retiring effective Nov. 5. Gray, who has served as Mellanox's CFO since Dec. '04, will be replaced by VP of Finance Jacob Shulman. (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM

  • The bouncy trading on Monster Worldwide (MWW +5.2%) continues as shares recover part of their...

    The bouncy trading on Monster Worldwide (MWW +5.2%) continues as shares recover part of their "jobs day" loss. Until visibility clears on the company's plan to find a buyer, analysts warn that the roller coaster ride could continue.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:29 AM
  • CTIC

    Biopharmaceutical company Cell Therapeutics (CTIC +6.9%) gains on optimism ahead of its...

    Biopharmaceutical company Cell Therapeutics (CTIC +6.9%) gains on optimism ahead of its presentation tomorrow at the annual Rodman & Renshaw global investment conference. The company is slated to discuss the marketing plans for its non-Hodgkin's lymphoma treatment Pixuvri in the European Union, as well as update the status of clinical trials of pacritinib, including plans to initiate a phase III trial in Q4.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:18 AM
  • SSL

    Sasol (SSL +2.6%), the world's largest producer of motor fuels from coal, says it is planning an...

    Sasol (SSL +2.6%), the world's largest producer of motor fuels from coal, says it is planning an expansion drive in North America and is looking for a buyer for its Iranian plant. CEO David Constable says SSL may build a gas-to-liquids plant in Louisiana that would produce 96K barrels of mostly diesel per day, and will decide by year's end whether to build a 48K bbl/day plant in Canada.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:16 AM | 1 Comment
  • S

    Sprint (S +3.2%) rallies on an upgrade to Buy from Nomura's Mike McCormack, who is lifting his...

    Sprint (S +3.2%) rallies on an upgrade to Buy from Nomura's Mike McCormack, who is lifting his target all the way to $7 from $2.50. McCormack argues Sprint is executing well on its 4G LTE buildout (and thereby keeping costs down); is competing effectively against AT&T and Verizon with the help of aggressive pricing; and thinks its EBITDA service margin can top 20% after spending recent years in the 16% range.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:03 AM | 1 Comment
  • TITN

    Agricultural and construction-equipment retailer Titan Machinery (TITN -19.8%) gets clobbered...

    Agricultural and construction-equipment retailer Titan Machinery (TITN -19.8%) gets clobbered after posting a mixed Q2 this morning. Revenue grew by double digits, but it's bottom line missed as margins were pressured by a drought and a competitive retail environment. The company also cut its earnings view for the year, now expecting its EPS to come in between $2.10 and $2.30, down from its previous view of around $2.55 and $2.75.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:58 AM
  • CSUN

    Some volatile solar stocks are jumping in early trading (TAN +2%). Possibly helping is a weekend...

    Some volatile solar stocks are jumping in early trading (TAN +2%). Possibly helping is a weekend WSJ column that notes U.S. solar installation doubled Y/Y in 1H12 thanks to plummeting prices, albeit while pointing out a lot of the installations involve foreign-made panels. Given heavy short interests, it often doesn't take much to produce a rally. CSUN +12.5%. STP +3.9%. CSIQ +3.6%. SPWR +3.1%. FSLR +2.4%. JKS +4.3%. TSL +4%. GTAT +10.5%. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:47 AM
  • SDRL

    Seadrill (SDRL -1.9%) is cut to Neutral at HSBC Securities, which notes industry fundamentals...

    Seadrill (SDRL -1.9%) is cut to Neutral at HSBC Securities, which notes industry fundamentals remain strong but the surprise factor is limited. The firm says $4B of ultra-deepwater contracts in July are a clear sign of drilling market momentum, but upside to market expectations is more limited vs. elsewhere in oil services. Also, SDRL plans to sell $1B in unsecured notes via a private offering for institutional investors.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:43 AM | 15 Comments
  • KS

    Shares of KapStone Paper (KS -3.2%), Packaging Corp (PKG -1.6%), and Rock-Tenn (RKT -4.1%) trade...

    Shares of KapStone Paper (KS -3.2%), Packaging Corp (PKG -1.6%), and Rock-Tenn (RKT -4.1%) trade lower on a containerboard sector downgrade from Deutsche Bank. The firm notes that the assumed "done deal" for a fall price hike isn't quite locked up. (Earlier: Deutsche downgrades International Paper)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:36 AM
  • BP

    Analysts say BP (BP +0.5%) got a good price for the Gulf oil fields it sold to Plains...

    Analysts say BP (BP +0.5%) got a good price for the Gulf oil fields it sold to Plains Exploration (PXP -8.3%) for $5.5B. "Significantly higher" than expected, says RBC, which had valued the assets at ~$2.2B. “A reduced and more focused exposure to the Gulf of Mexico is welcome for BP" amid escalated U.S. government pursuit of Macondo gross negligence charges, Tudor Pickering adds.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:29 AM | 1 Comment
  • LF

    Shares of LeapFrog (LF -9.5%) stumble again on heavy volume as valuation questions still linger...

    Shares of LeapFrog (LF -9.5%) stumble again on heavy volume as valuation questions still linger amongst traders. In addition, the company's plan to have a separate app universe outside of Apple and Google is starting to looking more challenging as it moves from paper to practice.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:15 AM
  • GMCR

    Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR +5.3%) opens strong as last week's momentum powered by...

    Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR +5.3%) opens strong as last week's momentum powered by analyst upgrades sustains. Though critics question the logic behind the "defense" from exposed sell-side analysts, shares are closing in on the $30 mark for the first time since early May.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:05 AM
  • MLNX

    Mellanox (MLNX -12%) tanks after SA contributor Kerrisdale Capital argues sales of the company's...

    Mellanox (MLNX -12%) tanks after SA contributor Kerrisdale Capital argues sales of the company's InfiniBand adapters will fall in 2013 as a server upgrade cycle centering around Intel's Romley Xeon CPUs winds down. Kerrisdale also criticizes Mellanox's valuation, and raises concerns about future competition from 40 Gbps Ethernet adapters, as well as Intel (previous). Mellanox's sales have taken off in tandem with the strong growth seen for top customer Oracle's high-end servers. (Stifel downgrade)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:00 AM
  • ANDV

    Tesoro (TSO +2%) pushes higher after a weekend Barron's story says the West Coast oil refiner...

    Tesoro (TSO +2%) pushes higher after a weekend Barron's story says the West Coast oil refiner "may have pulled off the acquisition of the year" when it reached a deal last month to purchase a large California refinery from BP for $1.175B. Investors pushed TSO stock up ~10% afterward, but shares still look appealing, trading for 6.8x projected 2012 profit of $5.84/share.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:45 AM

  • Shares of International Paper (IP -4.3%) slump after Deutsche Bank downgrades the company to...

    Shares of International Paper (IP -4.3%) slump after Deutsche Bank downgrades the company to Hold from Buy. Analysts lean cautious after IP's recent rally and with demand for its products tipping toward the sluggish side.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:43 AM
  • TELL

    Magellan Petroleum (MPET) -2.8% premarket after its board says it will not to pursue a proposal...

    Magellan Petroleum (MPET) -2.8% premarket after its board says it will not to pursue a proposal by Stratex Oil & Gas Holdings to acquire the company. The board says Stratex did not respond to a written request for financial statements, organizational structure, oil and gas properties, and terms and conditions of the "committed financing" for the cash component of the proposal.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM
  • CDMO

    Peregrine Pharmaceuticals (PPHM): FQ1 EPS of -$0.07 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $4.25M (-24.7%...

    Peregrine Pharmaceuticals (PPHM): FQ1 EPS of -$0.07 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $4.25M (-24.7% Y/Y) beats by $0.25M. Shares +1.1% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • KSW

    Premarket gainers: KSW +22%. CTIC +5%. Losers: GERN -47%. ZLCS -46%. TITN -16%.

    Premarket gainers: KSW +22%. CTIC +5%.
    Losers: GERN -47%. ZLCS -46%. TITN -16%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • JW.A

    John Wiley & Sons (NYSE:JW.A): FQ1 EPS of $0.52. Revenue of $411M (-4.41% Y/Y). Shares -2.5%...

    John Wiley & Sons (NYSE:JW.A): FQ1 EPS of $0.52. Revenue of $411M (-4.41% Y/Y). Shares -2.5% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:25 AM
  • BP

    BP confirms it has agreed to sell its interests in three BP-operated assets and two non-operated...

    BP confirms it has agreed to sell its interests in three BP-operated assets and two non-operated assets in the deepwater Gulf of Mexico to Plains Exploration and Production (NYSE:PXP) for $5.55B. Not giving up on the Gulf, BP says it anticipates investing on average at least $4B in the region each year for the next decade. PXP, which likely would take on debt to pay for the deal, -4.5% premarket.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:09 AM | 2 Comments
  • GERN

    Geron (NASDAQ:GERN) is discontinuing its Phase 2 study of imetelstat in HER2-negative breast...

    Geron (NASDAQ:GERN) is discontinuing its Phase 2 study of imetelstat in HER2-negative breast cancer because imetelstat performed worse than the control. It also says its Phase 2 study of imetelstat for lung cancer is unlikely to meet success. (PR)

    AIG -2.4% premarket as the Treasury is set to become a minority owner of the company - its sale...

    AIG -2.4% premarket as the Treasury is set to become a minority owner of the company - its sale of $18B in stock would leave it with about a 23% stake. With the Treasury no longer holding a majority stake, AIG comes under the regulatory purview of the Fed (by dint of its ownership of a small bank).

  • EU stocks hunker down into consolidation mode following last week's gains on Mario Draghi's...

    EU stocks hunker down into consolidation mode following last week's gains on Mario Draghi's bondbuying plan and ahead of three key events this week: the FOMC meeting, Germany ruling on the legality of the eurozone's ESM rescue fund, and an election in Holland. Euro Stoxx 50 -0.3%, London -0.2%, Paris -0.3%, Frankfurt -0.1% , Milan -0.3%, Madrid -0.4%.
